item.title: About
item.description: “The skill of writing is to create a context in which other people can think” — Edwin Schlossberg Thesis § As you peruse, you’ll notice that this isn’t your average blog.

item.title: Influences
item.description: Consider these our agricultural stewards: Andy Matuschak Maggie Appleton Jackie Zhao .

item.title: Grant Hale
item.description: Grant is a curious chap. You can find out more about him at his personal website.

item.title: Correspondent Banking
item.description: How is money sent from one person to the next? It depends on whether the person you are sending money to banked at the same place as you? References § A Simple Explanation of How Money Moves Around the Banking System.

item.title: Defining Technology
item.description: When someone invokes the word “technology”, they’re often implicitly referring to electronics. And while that’s one illustration, it’s far from the word’s main meaning.

item.title: SRSxLLM
item.description: Spaced repetition software (SRS) offers a powerful and simple way to reinforce learning but it takes time and energy to create questions to review, sometimes up to 2-3x longer than just reading the content itself.

item.title: Technology is Not Just Software
item.description: To define “technology” as information software is a disservice. See Defining Technology. Damn straight! Not only is it definitionally incorrect but it’s conceptually misleading.

item.title: Tools for Thought Empower Thinking and Expression
item.description: Tools for thought is a fairly self-explanatory term. You could consider a writing device as a tool for thought. technology that expands and improves our ability to work with and create ideas.
